Y. L. Gordon, sardonically observes that "if a man is stricken with leprosy,/If he catches any sort of sickness or ailment/There are physicians in the land, with magic in their hands,/There is hope for the ill that they can be saved.../But the words of a rabbi-who can change them,/Where can the lost ones turn to be saved?"
